node.title: Latest on COVID from around the world: European countries smash case records, China outbreak worsens
node.content: ["Here's the latest on the COVID-19 pandemic from around the world.\n", "The island reported a record 2241 infections on Tuesday, up from 1925 a day before. To date, there have been 154,926 cases reported and 630 deaths.", "Daily new coronavirus cases in Turkey jumped beyond 30,000 on Tuesday for the first time since October 19, data showed, as the health minister warned of the rapid spread of the Omicron variant.", "The UAE approved emergency use of Sinopharm's protein-based vaccine and it will be available to the public as a booster dose starting January.", "Research by South African scientists\u00a0suggests Omicron could displace the Delta variant of the coronavirus because infection with the new variant boosts immunity to the older one.", "The study only covered a small group of people and has not been peer-reviewed, but it found that people who were infected with Omicron, especially those who were vaccinated, developed enhanced immunity to the Delta variant.", "A record-high 179,807 new confirmed coronavirus cases were reported in a 24-hour period on Tuesday, by far the highest daily number since the start of the pandemic.", "The previous record of 104,611 was set on Saturday, after the 86,852 high of November 11, 2020, was broken with two consecutive days of more than 90,000 new cases per day at the end of last week.", "France will begin paying intensive care nurses an extra 100 euros (NZ$166) per month from January as it seeks to improve work conditions for staff exhausted by the fight against COVID-19.", "The UK reported a record 129,471 new cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, a day after Prime Minister Boris Johnson said he would not bring in new restrictions this year to limit the spread of the highly transmissible Omicron variant of the virus.", "Johnson said on Monday he would not introduce new restrictions in England, but his ministers have urged people to celebrate the New Year cautiously and warned that the rules could be tightened if the health system was at risk of failure.", "The UK government manages lockdown restrictions for England, home to most of the UK population. Devolved authorities for Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland have already tightened their rules, as have other European countries facing a surge in Omicron cases.", "Britain's record high of daily infections was 122,186 on December 24.", "Tuesday's data did not include figures for Scotland and Northern Ireland due to differences in reporting practices over the Christmas holidays. The 12,378 cases reported for Wales included data that would normally have been reported in previous days.", "UK ministers are waiting for more evidence on how the health service is able to cope with high infection rates after early data suggested last week that the Omicron variant carried a lower risk of hospital admission.", "Belgian theatres and other cultural venues won an initial legal victory on Tuesday to reopen after the government ordered their closure as part of coronavirus restrictions to curb a surge in cases of the Omicron variant.", "The country reported on Tuesday a record 17,172 new coronavirus infections, although the rate was about half the level of the worst surge at the start of the year and hospitalisations were an even smaller fraction of that.", "Demand for free COVID-19 testing kits provided by Madrid's regional government far outstripped supply on Tuesday, with long queues forming outside pharmacies in what has become a common scene since the Omicron variant began driving up infections.", "Just over 200 coronavirus-related deaths were reported on Tuesday against 142 the day before, the health ministry said, while the daily tally of new infections rose to 78,313 from 30,810, hitting a fresh record in terms of new cases since the start of the pandemic.", "The country reported a new daily record of 21,657 COVID-19 infections on Tuesday, more than double the level of the day before.", "The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said it raised COVID-19 related travel warnings for Malta, Moldova, Sweden and Argentina.", "For Malta, Moldova and Sweden, the travel warning was raised to level 4 or \"very high\" while for Argentina, it was raised to level 3 or \"high\", the CDC said on Tuesday.\u00a0", "Meanwhile, rising cases and bad weather caused airlines to cancel more than 1000 flights within or into and out of the US on Monday (local time), as the spread of the Omicron variant prompted the United States government's top infectious disease expert Anthony Fauci to suggest mandating vaccines for domestic flights.", "Japanese officials in the western city of Osaka have confirmed a cluster of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus, Kyodo news agency reported.", "Coronavirus vaccine booster shots have begun in the South Asian country as it tries to fend off the highly contagious Omicron variant.", "China's local coronavirus cases rose for a fourth day, with the majority of infections reported by Xian, a northwestern city that has put its 13 million people under lockdown.", "The country has lifted a travel ban on eight southern African countries that had been among the first to report the Omicron variant, citing the greater spread of the variant worldwide, and cut the wait time for booster vaccine doses.\u00a0", "European and Asian stocks inched higher, helped by another record-setting day on Wall St and after the UK and France held off from imposing more COVID curbs before year-end.", "Oil prices extended gains - trading near the previous day's one-month high on hopes the Omicron variant will have a limited impact on fuel demand."]
